review_blob:
I was lucky enough to find one last bottle sitting on the shelf, wow, the guy behind me sure looked disappointed when I got there first. Now I understand why. While I wanted to just sit and enjoy, I found it hard not to gulp it down like a big ol glass of Pepsi on a hot summer day. Flavorful, however, not too light, yet not too strong. Somehow you get the feeling this is the affect the creators of this masterpiece were going for. Ive never seen a beer foam quiet the way this does, when first poured I thought; where are the bubbles, then after it sat for a few seconds, appeared a nice head, not too overwhelming but just the perfect amount. If I were to craft a brew this would be just what I would hope to have as and end product.

Now as I sit here a watch The Grinch That Stole Christmas, I also find that it has that nice affect Gin has, putting that ear-to-ear smile on my face (Im sure its the coffee mixed with the alcohol). Just remember this isnt the cure for your problems just a cure for life. or as Homer would say; "Beer... Now theres a temporary solution." This should be on any Stout Lovers top ten list.

Taste and smells like Broccoli and Rootbeer. Nice color. At $7-$9 a bottle I would porbably pass on another. Very foamy. The wax cannot be wax the crap went everywhere, what a mess, then the cat tried to eat it.. However the wax is a good deterrent not to drink more.The picture on the label looks good. Overall a rather average brew. if it wasnt for the 8% ABV, I would have given it a lower score.
beer_name: Black Diamond Peak XV Imperial Porter

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob:
WOW, I counldnt think there could be anything better. Not even a doughnut.

Ok its all been said in other ratings. If you ever have the chance dont pass this one up. You will not be dissapointed if you enjoy a strong dark Ale
